alert.note: Alert for Genesee; Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Wyoming (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Lake Effect Snow Warning issued January 17 at 9:33PM EST until January 18 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...LAKE EFFECT SNOW WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST THURSDAY... * WHAT...Heavy lake effect snow. Additional snow accumulations of 9 to 18 inches in the most persistent lake snows...with the greatest of these focused from the Buffalo southtowns and western Genesee county into Southern Erie county. Storm totals could locally exceed 4 feet. The band will move back southward across the Buffalo southtowns and into southern Erie county overnight into Thursday morning, before shifting back north across the Buffalo metro area Thursday afternoon as it weakens and impacts areas closer the Lake Erie shore. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will result in blowing and drifting snow, with near whiteout conditions at times late this evening. * WHERE...Erie, Genesee, and Wyoming counties. * WHEN...Until 7 PM EST Thursday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Areas of blowing snow will significantly reduce visibility. The hazardous conditions will impact the morning commute. Bitter wind chills as low as 10 below zero could result in hypothermia if precautions are not taken.
info.instruction: Heavy snow will fall in relatively narrow bands. If traveling, be prepared for rapidly changing road conditions and visibilities. Submit snow reports through our website or social media.

area.areaDesc: Genesee; Northern Erie; Southern Erie; Wyoming
